appendix.title: Hidden Directories

highlights.para: This appendix describes the hidden directories that the MATE Desktop adds to the home directories of users.

appendix.para: A hidden directory is a directory that has a name that begins with a period (.). describes the hidden directories that the MATE Desktop adds to the home directories of users.

table.title: Hidden Directories in User Home Directories

entry.para: This is the default location for the environment variable XDG_CONFIG_HOME, if it is not set. User defined menus can be created at menus/applications.menu.
Contains fonts specific to a particular user. When a user installs a font by dragging it to the fonts:/// URI in caja, it is copied to this location.
Contains the authentication cookie for the MATE sound daemon. The MATE sound daemon is the Enlightened Sound Daemon (ESD).

para.emphasis: NOTE: This is a file, not a directory.

entry.para: Contains the MateConf configuration source for the user. When the user sets a preference, the new preference information is added to this location.
Contains the following MateConf daemon details:

listitem.para: Lock information for objects that are referenced by an Interoperable Object Reference (IOR).
State information for objects that are referenced by an IOR.

entry.para: Contains user-specific application data that is not stored in the MateConf repository.

para.emphasis: NOTE: this directory is deprecated and is only used by MATE 1.x applications.

entry.para: Contains user-specific application data that is not stored in the MateConf repository. For example, this directory contains the following:

listitem.para: Desktop entry files for panel launchers.

entry.para: This directory may also contain sub-directories that store application specific data.
Ignore this directory. This directory has no function at the time of publication of this guide.

This is the default location for the environment variable XDG_DATA_HOME, if it is not set. User defined desktop entries can be created in the subdirectory applications. User defined mime types can be created in mime/packages/Overrides.xml.
Contains session data for the Marco window manager.
Contains file manager data that is specific to the user. For example, this directory can contain the following:

listitem.para: Metadata for the directories with which the user works.
Caja emblems that the user adds.

entry.para: Contains controls theme options, window frame theme options, and icons theme options that the user adds. The user can add themes from the Theme preference tool.
Contains image thumbnails for the user. The image thumbnails are used in the file manager. The file manager contains a preference that the user can select to stop generation of thumbnail images.
